snippet: The U.S. has fallen behind its goal of training 24,000 Iraqi security forces by this fall, having only trained 9,000 so far.
abstract: Defense Sec Ashton B Carter tells House Committee on Armed Services reason they are falling short of fall deadline to train 24,000 Iraqi security force members to fight Islamic State group is because Iraqi government has not provided enough recruits.
lead_paragraph: The U.S. has fallen behind its goal of training 24,000 Iraqi security forces by this fall, having only trained 9,000 so far.

headline.main: Plan to Train Iraqi Soldiers Is Hampered by Lack of Recruits, Defense Chief Says
headline.print_headline: Washington; Plan to Train Iraqi Soldiers Is Hampered by Lack of Recruits, Defense Chief Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
